intro: Satureja icarica, commonly known as mountain thyme or wild thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small pink or white flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves and flowers are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications due to their fragrant, mint-like aroma.
